result.execSummary:
The defendant Thidora R Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two unless eligible and received disability.

No contact with Wausau Gun & Loan, and RJ's ink.
No contact with victim T.S.

Complete any counseling, assessment, or follow through deemed necessary by agent.
DNA sample 
Remit court costs and DNA surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 10:49am
INCLUDES 15CF851, 15CM1211, 16CM1967
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Pauline Toulouse. 
Date and time set for SAR in 15CF851 & 15CM1211 and plea in 16CM1967

SAR in 15CF851 & 15CM1211:
Parties state recommendation for sentencing.

COURT ORDERS: 15CF851 Ct. 2 (Theft-movable property <=$2500- repeater), Ct. 3 (BJ-Misd-repeater), 15CM1211 Ct. 1 (Criminal damage to property- repeater) On all counts serve 9 months MCJ. All three sentencing to run concurrently to each other. 97 days credit granted in 15CF851. Any outstanding costs in 15CF851 be converted into civil judgment of $317.00 to T.S. and $80.00 to Wausau Gun & Loan. 33 days credit granted in 15CM1211. Jail may be with huber release for work, work seach, or medical treatment if meets jail criteria. 

Plea in 16CM1967:
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
PLEA:
Ct. 1 Knowingly violate a domestic abuse order- injuction- repeater >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: Serve 150 days MCJ. Credit granted for 33 days already served. Sentence to run concurrent to SAR's. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. Jail may be with huber release for work, work search, or medical treatment if meets jail criteria. 

Adj: 11:04am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 1, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Case called: 3:34pm
INCLUDES 15CM712, 15CF851, and 15CM1211
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer.  Deft appears in person with Atty Lou Ann Bohn
Date and time was set for arraignments in all files & plea's on all files

Arraignment:
Information Filed. Reading Waived.

PLEA:

Ct. 3 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor-Repeater >> GUILTY
15CM1211

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Bohn states deft is currently applying for disability and is requesting to deny deft paying CC and DNA sample and surcharge

COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. Probation 18 months, concurrent. Complete any counseling, assessment, or follow through deemed necessary by agent. Pay $617 in restitution at $35 per month to victim. No contact with victim, T.S. No contact with Wausau, Gun, and Loan. No contact with RJ's ink. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, unless eligible and received disability. Pay CC. Remit cost in Ct. 3 15CF851 & Ct. 1 15CM1211. However, to pay DNA sample and surcharge in Ct. 2 15CF851

Adj: 3:54pm

for Discovery w/ Demand for Discovery and Inspection

No contact with victim(s):  R.J.'s, Inc.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
